com.javagameengine.scene

Class Component

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.javagameengine.scene.Component
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Camera, LaserComponent, LaserShot, Light, Music, PhysicsComponent, RenderableComponent, ShipControlComponent

    public abstract class Component
extends java.lang.Object
    Generic object used to define anything that affects the scene. All 'objects' in a scene extend Component and use the framework of component to define how they are rendered, updated, manipulated, or manipulate other objects during the game loop.

    Components are attached to Nodes in the scene graph and contain a reference to that node. Components are therefore the leaf 'nodes' of the scene graph.

    Author:
    ClairaLyrae

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void destroy()
      Removes this component from the parent node, if attached.
      Node getNode()
      Fetches the parent node of this component if available
      Scene getScene()
      Fetches the scene this component is in if available
      boolean isActive()
      Determines if this component is connected to a scene graph.
      boolean isDestroyed() 
      boolean isEnabled()
      Determines if component is allowing updates.
      boolean isLinked()
      Determines if this component is connected to a scene graph.
      void onActivate()
      Called when this component is either added to a node which is part of an active scene, or when the scene this node is part of is loaded
      void onDeactivate()
      Called when this component is either removed from a node which is part of an active scene, or when the scene this node is part of is unloaded
      void onLink()
      Called when this component is linked to a parent node, and that parent node is linked to a scene
      void onUnlink()
      Called when this component is unlinked from its parent node, and that parent node is linked to a scene
      void onUpdate(float deltaf)
      Update this component for the current frame
      void setEnabled(boolean bool)
      Enables or disables updating of this component.
      java.lang.String toString()

        public boolean isDestroyed()
        Returns:
        True if component was destroyed

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Removes this component from the parent node, if attached. If the component has no parent node and is unlinked, this method does nothing.

        Update this component for the current frame
        Parameters:
        deltaf - Time since last frame (seconds)

        Called when this component is unlinked from its parent node, and that parent node is linked to a scene

        Parameters:
        bool - True for enabled

        Returns:
